intro: Schizocodon soldanelloides f. purpureiflorus, commonly known as the purple-flowered form of the species, is a herbaceous plant characterized by its striking violet or purple flowers. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is native to regions in southern Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. This variant is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and botanical collections.
